message: I remember that they could install add-ons to the chat rooms though. It was awesome. You could hang out in the chat (like this) and for those of you that opted into the game, you'd be in there shooting guns and things at each other. All text-based.

So yeah, there were things like Prodigy and AOL for all those chatrooms, but I really grew up with things like MajorBBS and multi-user chatrooms that were available to only as many people as there were phone lines.
Prodigy was first for me, I'm not 1337
The other people not playing couldn't see it, I don't think. I'm sure I have it stored away in a chat log somewhere.
That sounds kind of insane, hah
I grew up on Cleveland Free-Net IRC, followed by EFnet and LinuxNET, and then a private hosted network.
